info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Litchfield County through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Norfolk to near Northwest Harwinton to near Southbury. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Thomaston, New Hartford, Terryville, New Hartford Center, Woodbury Center, Northwest Harwinton, Oakville, Watertown, Plymouth, Woodbury, Harwinton, Barkhamsted, Torringford, Hotchkissville, Pequabuck, Reynolds Bridge, Nepaug, Hancock and Pomeraug. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Connecticut.
